Section.Catchline: Waiver and variance of rights and duties.

SectionBody.Text: Except as otherwise provided in s. 679.624, to the extent that they give rights to a debtor or obligor and impose duties on a secured party, the debtor or obligor may not waive or vary the rules stated in the following listed sections:

Subsection.Text: Section 679.2071(2)(d)3., which deals with use and operation of the collateral by the secured party;
Section 679.210, which deals with requests for an accounting and requests concerning a list of collateral and statement of account;
Section 679.607(3), which deals with collection and enforcement of collateral;
Sections 679.608(1) and 679.615(3) to the extent that they deal with application or payment of noncash proceeds of collection, enforcement, or disposition;
Sections 679.608(1) and 679.615(4) to the extent that they require accounting for or payment of surplus proceeds of collateral;
Section 679.609 to the extent that it imposes upon a secured party that takes possession of collateral without judicial process the duty to do so without breach of the peace;
Sections 679.610(2), 679.611, 679.613, and 679.614, which deal with disposition of collateral;
Section 679.615(6), which deals with calculation of a deficiency or surplus when a disposition is made to the secured party, a person related to the secured party, or a secondary obligor;
Section 679.616, which deals with explanation of the calculation of a surplus or deficiency;
Sections 679.620, 679.621, and 679.622, which deal with acceptance of collateral in satisfaction of obligation;
Section 679.623, which deals with redemption of collateral;
Section 679.624, which deals with permissible waivers; and
Sections 679.625 and 679.626, which deal with the secured party’s liability for failure to comply with this article.
